intro: Cinchona discolor, commonly known as the white cinchona, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark contains alkaloids, though it is not as well-known for medicinal properties as other cinchona species. Cinchona discolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
